title: Albury Park Walking Route

images.title: Colin Smith / Albury Park Mansion
images.caption: Albury Park Mansion. Mansion set in extensive parkland. Here lived the Malthus family (of economics fame) and latterly Henry Drummond (19th century banker and politician). Drummond funded the rebuilding of Albury village 1 mile west, out of Albury Park.

images.title: Colin Smith / Footpath, Albury Park
images.caption: Footpath in the park. Looking downhill, the path is lined by mixed woodland and by rhododendrons. It traverses the private Albury Estate. In the distance is the scarp slope of the North Downs above Sherbourne Farm.

images.title: Colin Smith / Entering Albury Park
images.caption: Entering Albury Park. The footpath traverses the private estate form Park Road to the Saxon Church. It goes through mixed woodland on this sandy hill.

images.title: Colin Smith / Albury Warren
images.caption: Albury Warren. Sandy heathland with mixed woodland and timber stacks south-east of Albury village.

images.title: Colin Smith / Albury Church
images.caption: Albury Church in the nearby village. The 19th century parish church of St Peter and St Paul with St Martha's Hill, and hilltop church, in the background.

images.title: Ben Gamble / Old Cottages, Albury
images.caption: Old Cottages in Albury village to the west of the park. There are several buildings in this area with these distinctive spiral chimneys. This row of cottages includes the old Post Office.

images.title: P L Chadwick / Mill House Lake
images.caption: Mill House Lake. This fly fishing lake is part of Weston Fishery, which is run by Albury Estate Fisheries. In the foreground is the small River Tillingbourne, sometimes spelt Tilling Bourne. This pretty area is just to the west of the park and makes a nice extension to the walk.

description: Explore the Albury Estate on this pleasant walk in Surrey. There's 150 acres of parkland with lots of walking trails to try. Features include peaceful woodland, pretty lakes and the River Tillingbourne. There is also the Grade II listed Albury country house and the Saxon Old St Peter and St Paul's Church to see. The walk starts from the Grade I listed church and follows footpaths through woodland and parkland to the nearby village of Shere. Here you will find a Norman church, old village houses and a tea room for refreshments. The walk then follows the Fox Way and other footpaths to return you to Albury. If you'd like to extend your walk then you could continue along the Fox Way to the nearby Blackheath Common . The tranquil Silent Pool is also nearby. Our 9 mile circular walk from Shere visits the park and also heads to the popular viewpoints at St Martha's Hill and Newlands Corner .
